item.title: Massimo Vignelli's Signed 2012 NYC Subway Diagram
item.description:
Massimo Vignelli's Signed 2012 NYC Subway Diagram

Less than one year ago, the world lost one of its most important creative minds with the passing of Massimo Vignelli. The celebrated graphic designer bestowed upon us a great number of now-iconic designs, though perhaps none more visibly lasting than his 1972 MTA New York City Transit subway map.

item.title: High Velocity Aerial Filming
item.description:
High Velocity Aerial Filming

Aerial Filming took a giant leap forward when Blue Sky and Peter Degerfeldt challenged Gyro-stabilized Systems in Grass Valley, US, to build a GSS 520 5 axis system that would produce rock solid images at a speed of more than 300 knots per hour.

item.title: Wearable Sun Protection
item.description:
Wearable Sun Protection

There's no faster way to throw shade on a warm weather vacation (or the first few hot days of spring) than with sunburn. It takes only 15 minutes of direct sunlight exposure for skin damage to begin occurring, so protection is a must.

item.title: Where to Eat Pizza: Phaidon presents the ultimate pizza bucket list | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine
item.description:
Where to Eat Pizza: Phaidon presents the ultimate pizza bucket list | Lifestyle | Wallpaper* Magazine

There are two kinds of books in this world: those everyone ought to read, and those that you must own. Phaidon's latest launch, Where To Eat Pizza, is both. Following on from 2015's great success Where Chefs Eat, Daniel Young's Where to Eat Pizza is an anthology of the best pizza places around the globe.

item.title: Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set
item.description:
Moleskine's Comprehensive Smart Writing Set

At a conference on productivity-which touched on everything from the importance of tech-free alone time to the educational and emotional benefits of writing by hand (as outlined in a series of studies on the subject)- Moleskine unveiled their latest analog-to-digital wonder.
